model.py¶

class model.Model(classifier, X, y, val_method, val_size, k, stratify)¶

An instance of this class stores information about a trained classifier. In particular, it contains:

  • data for training and evaluation
  • classifier object
  • classifier’s hyperparameters
  • classifier’s name
  • user’s comment on the classifier
  • performance metrics on training data
  • performance metrics on validation data
  • performance metrics on test data (if the classifier has been tested)
Variables:
  • counter (int) – number of existing classifiers, used in default classifier names.
  • classifier (sklearn classifier object) – the classifier object, see sklearn documentation for details.
  • X (pandas dataframe) – feature values of training data (including training and validation sets)
  • y (pandas series) – labels of training data
  • name_ (str) – name of the classifier
  • type_ (str) – type of the classifier (defined in child classes)
  • comment_ (str) – user comment on the classifier
  • params_ (dict) – hyperparameters of the classifier (see sklearn classifier documentation for details)
  • train_metrics (ModelMetrics) – performance metrics of the classifier on training data
  • val_metrics (ModelMetrics) – performance metrics of the classifier on validation data
  • test_metrics (ModelMetrics) – performance metrics of the classifier on test data
_Model__cross_validation(classifier, X, y, k, stratify=True)¶

Performs classifier validation through cross-validation. This function is also used by leave-one-out validation.

Parameters:
  • classifier (sklearn classifier object) – classifier for validation
  • X (pandas dataframe) – feature values of training data (including training and validation sets)
  • y (pandas series) – labels of training data
  • k (int) – number of folds
  • stratify (bool) – draw samples according to class proportions or not
Returns:

performance metrics on training and validation data
_Model__hold_out_validation(classifier, X, y, val_size, stratify=True)¶

Performs classifier validation using held-out data.

Parameters:
  • classifier (sklearn classifier object) – classifier for validation
  • X (pandas dataframe) – feature values of training data (including training and validation sets)
  • y (pandas series) – labels of training data
  • val_size (float) – percent of validation data
  • stratify (bool) – draw samples according to class proportions or not
Returns:

performance metrics on training and validation data
__init__(classifier, X, y, val_method, val_size, k, stratify)¶

Constructs a new instance of the class.

Parameters:
  • classifier (sklearn classifier object) – the classifier object, see sklearn documentation for details.
  • X (pandas dataframe) – feature values of training data (including training and validation sets)
  • y (pandas series) – labels of training data
  • val_method (str) – validation method (‘holdout’, ‘cv’, ‘loo’)
  • val_size (float) – percent of validation data (only used when val_method=’holdout’)
  • k (int) – number of folds (only used when val_method=’cv’)
  • stratify (bool) – draw samples according to class proportions or not
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

clear()¶

Starts the counter from zero.

comment()¶

Returns comment on the classifier.

Returns:comment on the classifier
metrics(option)¶

Returns performance metrics on the specified data.

  • option=’train’: metrics on training data
  • option=’val’: metrics on validation data
  • option=’test’: metrics on test data
Parameters:option (str) – ‘train’, ‘val’ or ‘test’
Returns:performance metrics on the specified data
name()¶

Returns name of the classifier.

Returns:name of the classifier
params()¶

Returns hyperparameters of the classifier.

Returns:hyperparameters of the classifier
plot_decision_regions(option, canvas)¶

Plots data with decision regions. This is only enabled for data with 2D continuous features.

Reference:
http://scikit-learn.org/stable/auto_examples/classification/plot_classifier_comparison.html
Parameters:
  • option (pandas dataframe) – ‘train’ or ‘test’
  • canvas (FigureCanva) – the canvas where the plot is drawn
predict(X, path)¶

Predicts labels for new data using the classifier. Saves the prediction in a new file.

Parameters:
  • X (pandas dataframe) – features values of new data
  • path (str) – where the prediction is saved
set_comment(comment)¶

Sets comment on the classifier.

Parameters:comment (str) – user-supplied comment
set_name(name)¶

Sets name of the classifier.

Parameters:name (str) – user-supplied classifier name
summary(view)¶

Displays a summary of classifier performance. The summary is organized in a tree structure.

Parameters:view (QTreeWidget) – the widget where the summary is displayed
test(X, y)¶

Tests a classifier. This function adds performance metrics on test data.

Parameters:
  • X (pandas dataframe) – feature values for test data
  • y (pandas series) – labels for test data
type()¶

Returns type of the classifier.

Returns:type of the classifier
class model.DecisionTree(classifier, X, y, val_method, val_size, k, stratify)¶

An instance of this class stores information about a trained decision tree classifier. It inherits the Model class.

__init__(classifier, X, y, val_method, val_size, k, stratify)¶

See Model class.

class model.RandomForest(classifier, X, y, val_method, val_size, k, stratify)¶

An instance of this class stores information about a trained random forest classifier. It inherits the Model class.

__init__(classifier, X, y, val_method, val_size, k, stratify)¶

See Model class.

class model.NaiveBayes(classifier, X, y, val_method, val_size, k, stratify, mode)¶

An instance of this class stores information about a trained naive bayes classifier. It inherits the Model class.

__init__(classifier, X, y, val_method, val_size, k, stratify, mode)¶

See Model class. The extra parameter mode indicates gaussian or multinomial NB.

Parameters:mode (str) – ‘gaussian’ or ‘multinomial’
